title: Bernard Sinclair
text:
Bernard Sinclair (1937 – 27 November 2015) was a French singer (<a href="baritone">baritone</a>) particularly associated with the repertoire of the <a href="op%C3%A9ra%20comique">opéra comique</a> and <a href="operetta">operetta</a>, but also <a href="opera">opera</a>. He is also an actor, playwright and director. He died in the <a href="10th%20arrondissement%20of%20Paris">10th arrondissement of Paris</a>.
Life.
Sinclair was born in 1937, in <a href="Marcq-en-Bar%C5%93ul">Marcq-en-Barœul</a> in the <a href="Nord%20%28French%20department%29">Nord</a> department. He was first a medical student, before turning to a lyrical career, on the advice of Élie Delfosse, who was to become director of the <a href="Op%C3%A9ra%20de%20Nancy">Opéra de Nancy</a>.
From the very beginning, he immediately took up the leading roles of <a href="op%C3%A9ra%20comique">opéra comique</a> and operetta in provincial theatres. It is true that this seductive "baritone-martin" has a lot for him, a voice full of charm and radiant treble, a fine musicality, a physical youthful prime, joined to an elegance and a talent of comedian.
Paris discovered him in 1966 in "La danseuse aux étoiles" at the <a href="Th%C3%A9%C3%A2tre%20Mogador">Théâtre Mogador</a>. Very quickly he appeared at the <a href="Th%C3%A9%C3%A2tre%20du%20Ch%C3%A2telet">Théâtre du Châtelet</a>, the <a href="Th%C3%A9%C3%A2tre%20du%20Palais-Royal">Théâtre du Palais-Royal</a>, and the <a href="Op%C3%A9ra-Comique">Opéra-Comique</a>. There he sang a few roles of opéra comiques and opera.
Repertory.
but above all the operetta repertoire in which he excelled particularly well, his favourite roles being: Franz Lehár's "<a href="Paganini%20%28operetta%29">Paganini</a>", Danilo in "<a href="The%20Merry%20Widow">The Merry Widow</a>", "<a href="Der%20Zarewitsch">Der Zarewitsch</a>", Brissac in "<a href="Les%20Mousquetaires%20au%20couvent">Les Mousquetaires au couvent</a>", "Le Comte de Luxembourg", Goethe in "Frédérique", Sou-Chong in "<a href="The%20Land%20of%20Smiles">The Land of Smiles</a>", etc.
Recordings.
Throughout his career. he recorded numerous works, first for the lyrical service of the <a href="ORTF">ORTF</a>, and then for the recording house <a href="EMI%20Group">EMI</a>, in particular "<a href="La%20Fille%20de%20madame%20Angot">La Fille de madame Angot</a>", "<a href="Les%20Cloches%20de%20Corneville">Les Cloches de Corneville</a>", and "<a href="Walzer%20aus%20Wien">Walzer aus Wien</a>", with <a href="Mady%20Mespl%C3%A9">Mady Mesplé</a>.
New career on stage.
Over the past few years, he has approached several classic roles ("<a href="Le%20Cid">Le Cid</a>"), created ("<a href="Tessa%20%28play%29">Tessa, la nymphe au cœur fidèle</a>"), created and directed his own play," Les Mouettes d' Étretat", in which he plays the lead role of an old prisoner tyrannized by his cellmate at the . At the beginning of 2014, he produced and played "Maille à partir", a text created for him by , at .
